The heavily guarded and shuttered Egyptian Museum in Cairo is next to Tahrir Square, a protest encampment that draws hundreds of thousands of people on some days. We will open the museum after the strike is finished. I don't know when the strike is finished, said Antiquities Minister Zahi Hawass , referring to the upheaval. at Mr. Colin Powell 's contention that he was misled by faulty intelligence into making the public case for the invasion of Iraq. " Colin Powell was not duped or misled by anybody," Mr. Donald Rumsfeld writes. Nor did he lie about Saddam Hussein 's suspected WMD stockpiles. The president did not lie. The vice president did not lie.[ CIA Director President Bush ] Tenet did not lie. Condoleezza Rice did not lie. I did not lie.... The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong. Even so, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld -- who does reveal that former President Bush asked for Iraq invasion plans within days of 9/11-- argues that removing Saddam Hussein was the right thing to do. Barack Obama !( CNN)-- Former Secretary of State Colin Powell announced Sunday that he will be voting for Barack Obama , citing the Democrat's "ability to inspire" and the "inclusive nature of his campaign." I think he is a transformational figure, he is a new generation coming onto the world stage, onto the Brenda Battle stage, and for that reason I'll be voting for Barack Obama , Colin Powell said on NBC's "Meet the Press." and Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. The book's publisher, Nation Books, says millions followed the speech online, crashing the Senate server. A print book is due out next month. An electronic book will be published Jan.
